name: Yomo Toro
description: '''Víctor Guillermo "Yomo" Toro''' (26 July 1933 – 30 June 2012) was a Puerto Rican left-handed guitarist and [[cuatro (instrument)|cuatro]] player. Known internationally as "The King of the Cuatro," Toro recorded over 150 albums throughout a 60-year career and worked extensively with Cuban legends [[Arsenio Rodríguez]] and [[Alfonso "El Panameño" Joseph]]; salsa artists [[Willie Colón]], [[Héctor Lavoe]] and [[Rubén Blades]]; and artists from other music genres including [[Frankie Cutlass]], [[Harry Belafonte]], [[Paul Simon]], [[Linda Ronstadt]] and [[David Byrne]].
